name: Taktile
headline: Empowers decision makers to make smarter and safer decisions at scale
description: Taktile eliminates guesswork and empowers decision-makers to build and evaluate automated decision flows faster than ever before.

founders.name: Maik Taro Wehmeyer, Founder
founders.description: Industrial Engineer (Harvard University, École Polytechnique, Karlsruhe Institute of Technology) that loves building tech

founders.name: Maximilian Eber, Founder
founders.description: Born and raised in Germany. Undergrad at the London School of Economics. PhD in Financial Economics at Harvard. Moved to private sector and spent a few years building custom ML solutions for e-commerce, insurance, and healthcare applications. Started Taktile to shorten the road to production for ML-applications.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Taktile**

**Founded:** 2020  
**Location:** Berlin, Germany  
**Employee count:** 60  
**Y Combinator Batch:** S20  
**Website:** [taktile.com](http://www.taktile.com)  

**Mission:**  
Taktile aims to empower decision-makers to make smarter and safer decisions at scale. Originally, they focused on eliminating guesswork by enabling rapid construction and evaluation of automated decision flows.

**What They Do:**  
Taktile provides a robust platform that allows users to automate complex risk decisions across various stages in customer interactions—think onboarding, underwriting, and transaction monitoring—across both Business-to-Business (B2B) and Business-to-Consumer (B2C) verticals. This tool is particularly valuable for financial service providers looking to streamline operations and harness the power of machine learning without needing constant IT intervention.

**Core Features:**
- **Automated Decision Logic:** Users can launch products and optimize decisions without engineering headaches.
- **Real-Time Testing:** Validate adjustments on real-world data without long lead times.
- **Seamless Integrations:** Connect easily to data providers to enhance the decision-making process.
  
**Market Position:**  
As a standout player in machine learning and enterprise software, Taktile addresses a critical gap in decision-making within finance and other industries. They provide tools that not only enhance efficiency but also improve the quality of risk assessments.

**Leadership:**  
The company benefits from guidance under Harj Taggar, a Group Partner at Y Combinator, thus aligning themselves closely with the leading trends in fintech innovation.

**User Testimonials:**  
Taktile has received positive feedback from various professionals across the financial sector. Users laud the platform for its intuitive design and capacity for rapid adaptation to regulatory changes—an essential feature in today’s fast-paced environment.

**In Summary:**  
Taktile is more than just a software provider; they’re revolutionizing how businesses handle decision-making. By removing the burden of guesswork and facilitating better risk assessments, Taktile is paving the way for more agile and secure business practices. If you’re in finance or other decision-heavy industries, definitely take a look at what they offer.
